SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.client.view
Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model

Class Bookshelf

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.Bookshelf
All Implemented Interfaces:
AbleToGetPoints
public class Bookshelf extends Object implements AbleToGetPoints
This method represents a bookshelf, where the player can collect items. It has rows (6 by default) and columns (5 by default) columns. Each cell can contain an item.
See Also:
  • Item

  • Constructor Details

    • Bookshelf

      public Bookshelf(int rows, int columns)
      Creates a new bookshelf.

      booleanMatrix is used to check if a cell can be visited (and it has not been visited yet). It is initialized to true.

      Parameters:
      rows - the number of rows of the bookshelf
      columns - the number of columns of the bookshelf
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if either rows or columns is less than 1

    • Bookshelf

      public Bookshelf()
      Creates a new bookshelf with the default number of rows and columns.

      public int numCellsToHighlight()
      Returns the number of cells to highlight in the board.
      Returns:
      the maximum number of the cells to highlight in the board, depending on the number of free cells in the columns

      public void clearBooleanMatrix()
      Clears the boolean matrix by setting all the cells to true.

    • clearBookshelf

      public void clearBookshelf()
      Deletes all the items in the bookshelf by setting them to Optional.empty() and clears the boolean matrix.

    • isBookshelfFull

      public boolean isBookshelfFull()
      Returns a boolean to indicate whether the bookshelf is full or not.
      Returns:
      true if the bookshelf is full, false otherwise.

    • insert

      public void insert(int column, List<Item> items)
      Inserts a list of items in a column.
      Parameters:
      column - the column index
      items - the list of items to insert
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the column index is not between 0 and the number of columns
      IllegalArgumentException - if the list of items is empty
      IllegalArgumentException - if there are more items to insert than free cells in the column

    • getItemAt

      public Optional<Item> getItemAt(int row, int column) throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      Parameters:
      row - the row index (starting from 0).
      column - the column index (starting from 0).
      Returns:
      the item in the position (row, column).
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

    • isRowFull

      public boolean isRowFull(int row) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns a boolean to indicate whether the row is full or not.
      Parameters:
      row - the index of the row to check.
      Returns:
      true if the row is completely full, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • isColumnFull

      public boolean isColumnFull(int col) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns a boolean to indicate whether the column is full or not.
      Parameters:
      col - the index of the column to check.
      Returns:
      true if the column is completely full, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the column index is not between 0 (inclusive) and the number of columns (exclusive).

    • getPoints

      public int getPoints()
      Calculates the points given by adjacent item tiles in this bookshelf. Groups of adjacent item tiles of the same type grant points depending on how many tiles are connected (with one side touching). Items with the same background color are considered of the same type.
      Specified by:
      getPoints in interface AbleToGetPoints
      Returns:
      the total score given by adjacent groups of items in this bookshelf
      See Also:
      • adjacentGroups(Color, int, int)
      • calculateGroupPoints(int)

    • adjacentGroups

      public int adjacentGroups(Color color, int row, int column)
      Counts the size of the group of adjacent items of the same colors, starting from the (row, column) cell.
      Parameters:
      color - the color to match
      row - the starting row
      column - the starting column
      Returns:
      the size of the group

    • calculateGroupPoints

      public int calculateGroupPoints(int matches)
      Calculates the points given by a group of adjacent items of the same type. Points are calculated as follows:
      • 2 points for 3 adjacent tiles of the same type
      • 3 points for 4 adjacent tiles of the same type
      • 5 points for 5 adjacent tiles of the same type
      • 8 points for 6 or more adjacent tiles of the same type
      Parameters:
      matches - the number of adjacent items of the same type
      Returns:
      the points given by a group of items

    • getColumnContent

      public List<Item> getColumnContent(int col) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Gets the content of a column as a list of items. Empty cells are not included.
      Parameters:
      col - the column index
      Returns:
      the items in the column
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the column index is not between 0 and the number of columns

    • getRowContent

      public List<Item> getRowContent(int row) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Gets the content of a row as a list of items. Empty cells are not included.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index
      Returns:
      the items in the row
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the row index is not between 0 and the number of rows

    • getItems

      public Optional<Item>[][] getItems()
      Used to get all the items in the bookshelf.
      Returns:
      the items in the bookshelf
